result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandy Lee Tveten

defendant.name: Tveten, Brandy Lee
defendant.address: 5063 N South Main Street, Winter, WI 54896

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Defendant Brandy Lee Tveten in court with Attorney Terry L. Nussberger appeared by video for Brandy Lee Tveten.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond by Mr. Nussberger.  Bond was set in this matter with absolute sobriey, no bars/taverns.  We made a motion to modify bond to allow him to go into a bar/restaurant where he lives in a small town in Winter WI that serves food that has a menu.  He has complied with bond and will continue to do so.  He has not consumed alcohol.  No objection by State.  Court modifies bond order to allow Mr. Tventen to enter a licensed establishment provided the primary source of revenue is from food and not alcohol and he be remove from premises immediately after consuming any food.  We WTL for PH, have received discovery and an offer I need to review with my client.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:00 PM Defendant Brandy Lee Tveten in court with Attorney Nicholis Schroeder by zoom technology by video means.  Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means.  State has not had a chance to discuss resolution with Atty Schroeder.  Atty Schroeder has not yet been assigned yet and ask 30-60 days out and discussed PH with Mr. Tveten and he will waive his TL.  Court finds on advise of counsel Mr. Tveten WTL for PH.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Brandy Lee Tveten appeared by zoom technology by video means from the Pepin County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Based upon Mr. Tveten's criminal history, long way back, State ask for $2500 signature bond with conditions, no contact with SJJ or her residence where this alleged crime took place and no possession or consumption of alcohol or entry into bars or taverns.  Court orders those conditions.  Mr. Tveten does wish time to talk to an attorney.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
